azimuth

project location.

## Posts 0900-0999

0900 - ADN Revit API Training Material Update and Vacation - After cleaning up the usage of
deprecated Revit API calls in
The Building Coder samples, I decided to clean up the ADN training material as well.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Parameters - ﻿
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Rooms and Spaces - The new method Autodesk.Revit.Elements.Room.IsPointInRoom determines if a 3D point is in the volume of a room.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Grids - The new method Autodesk.Revit.Elements.Grid.ExtendToAllLevels() method allows grids to intersect all levels of a project.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Batch creation methods (NewWalls, NewGrids, - If one of the elements which is supposed to be created can't be created the entire the operation will be properly rolled back.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Rebar - NewRebar:StartHookOrientation and EndHookOrientation arguments were changed to an enum. Rebar.SetLayoutRuleWithoutExaminingHost value type was changed to an enum.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Structural framing - Beams created with an offset from their level now have their analytical model aligned with the physical geometry of the beam.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Categories - Internal categories that are not directly exposed through the Revit UI can be accessed via the API. This makes it possible to add shared parameters to Materials using Revit API.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Sketch - Autodesk.Revit.Elements.Sketch.CurveLoop now returns CurveArrayArray instead of CurveArray. If the sketch contains multiple loops, the output will be segregated into separate CurveArrays within the ou...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Revit session properties - The new Autodesk.Revit.Application.Language property identifies the language used in the current session of Revit.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - External Commands and Applications - Revit now offers improved diagnostics when Revit is unable to run an external application or command listed in the Revit.ini file. A popup message will explain the problem. If the problem is related t...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - HostedSweep - In the Autodesk.Revit.Elements.HostedSweep class the new abstract method AddSegment() allows applications to write generic code that operates upon all hosted sweep types (gutter, fascia, or slab edge)...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - VolumeCalculationOptions - The Autodesk.Revit.VolumeCalculationOptions.VolumeComputationEnbale field was removed. Use the property VolumeComputationEnable instead.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Curtain Systems - Autodesk.Revit.Elements.CurtainGridLine new property ExistingSegmentCurves allows access to the existing segments in the grid line (excluding those which have been removed).
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Output Arguments from API methods - Output arguments are now marked with the [Out] attribute. Methods changed include:
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Visual Studio Tools for Applications (VSTA) - Revit's macro functionality is now based on VSTA 2.0. More information about VSTA and version 2.0 are available on Microsoft's
MSDN Developer Center.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Find references in the direction of a ray - This new method returns a reference array of all references found when moving through the Revit model from a specified point at a specified direction.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Reference parsing - The Autodesk.Revit.Geometry.Reference class now offers properties to extract the element, geometry object, transform, point, and parameters of the referenced item.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Element Hiding - To allow hiding and un-hiding of elements via the API, the methods View.Hide(ElementSet) and View.Unhide(ElementSet) have been added. The properties Element.IsHidden(View) and Element.CanBeHidden(View...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Parameter.Set return value when value is unchanged - Previously, Revit returned False if the input value for Parameter.Set was the same as the current value. Revit now returns True in this case.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - NoConditionType removed for Spaces - The NoConditionType enum has been removed as an option for Spaces. All spaces must have a ConditionType value and the default is HeatedAndCooled. A user wishing to specify an unconditioned space may u...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Detail Curves use sketch plane of their view - NewDetailCurve and NewDetailCurveArray no longer require specification of a sketch plane. The sketch plane of the view is used.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - SketchPlane property added to View class - The property View.SketchPlane has been created to return a view's sketch plane.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Export family data to XML for Autodesk Seek - The method ExtractPartAtomFromFamilyFile will open a family file and create an XML file with data used by Autodesk Seek for content search.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Exceptions when parameters are disabled - Set and Get for the following parameters may now result in exceptions when the parameter is disabled for the specified object: View.Scale, RoofBase.FasciaDepth, FootPrintRoof.SlopeAngle
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New options for export to DWF - The new option DWF2DExportOptions.ExportFormat allows specification of the paper format for the DWF.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New option for export to FBX - The new option FBXExportOptions.StopOnError controls whether or not the export process stops when an error is generated during export of one view, or whether Revit attempts to continue the export for ...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New method for export to DGN - The new method Document.Export(String, String, ViewSet, DGNExportOptions) exports a Revit project exports a model into DGN format.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New method for export to Civil3D - The new method Document.Export(String, String, View3D, ViewPlan, BuildingSiteExportOptions) exports a Revit project exports a model in the format of Civil Engineering design applications.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New method for import from gbXML - The new method Document.Import(String, GBXMLImportOptions) imports a Green-Building XML file into Revit.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New method for import from Inventor - The new method Document.Import(String, InventorImportOptions) imports an Inventor file into Revit. The Inventor file must be a .adsk file exported from Inventor for the purposes of transfer to Revit.
...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Document.Application property - The new property Document.Application returns the Application object which contains this document.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - New element collector properties - Two new methods for collecting elements have been added.
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - ImportInstance elements - A new element sub-type ImportInstance represents external geometry content such as DWG that has been imported to Revit. This element type is also output from the Import() methods, however, those metho...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - LocationCurve.ElementsAtJoin - This property has changed type since Revit release 2009. The property now returns an ElementArray, instead of List.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Element material quantities - The API provides access to the material quantities for a material in a given element. These values are the same values calculated by Revit to show in material takeoff schedules. In some cases the valu...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Instance.Transformed and Geometry of Instances - This property has been removed. Obtain the transformed geometry of the instance using Instance.GetInstanceGeometry(), Instance.GetSymbolGeometry(Transform) and Instance.GetInstanceGeometry(Transform)
...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - PlaceGroup() - The method Autodesk.Revit.Creation.Document.PlaceGroup() has been modified to correctly interpret the coordinates of the input point in the coordinates of the document. Previously it interpreted the p...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - gbXMLParamElem.ShadingSurfaces - This property has been removed and replaced with gbXMLParamElem.ExportComplexity with a wider variety of options.
---
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Creating topography surfaces - The new methods
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Changes to Printing - The workflows used to change print settings via the PrintManager class have changed. Previously, changes to settings happened immediately and would be visible in the Revit Print dialogs and applicable...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Geometry extraction - A new option Autodesk.Revit.Geometry.Options.IncludeNonVisibleObjects has been added. Use this option to instruct Revit to include GeometryObjects whose Visibility type is something other than ‘Visibl...
0901 - What's New in Revit 2010 API - Additional enums - Several enums have been added to the Revit API to assist developers with interpretation of the values of certain BuiltInParameter types:
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Changes to the Revit API namespaces - The Revit API namespaces have been changed to be more consistent and more suitable to expansion. In previous releases, API classes were split along the lines of functionality and Revit vertical produc...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Split of Revit API DLL - The Revit API has been split into two DLLs. The new DLLs are:
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - New classes for XYZ, UV, and ElementId - New classes have been introduced for the basic XYZ, UV and ElementId classes used in the API. These classes are:
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Replacement for Symbol and properties that access - The Symbol class has been renamed to ElementType.
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - New transaction interfaces - New interfaces have been added to the API related to Transactions. These interfaces will provide a more comprehensive set of options for managing changes being made to the Revit document.
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - New ExternalCommand and ExternalApplication - The Revit API now offers the ability to register API applications via a .addin manifest file.
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - External Command and External Application registration - The .NET utility DLL RevitAddInUtility.dll offers a dedicated API capable of reading, writing and modifying Revit Add-In manifest files. It is intended for use from product installers and scripts. Con...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Attributes for configuring ExternalCommand and - The custom attribute Autodesk.Revit.Attributes.TransactionMode should be applied to your implementation class of the IExternalCommand interface to control transaction behavior for external command. Th...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - New element iteration interfaces - New interfaces have been added to the API to permit iteration of elements and element ids. These new interfaces have been designed to provide a more flexible and usable interface for a variety of appl...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Replacement for View.Elements - The property View.Elements has been removed and replaced with a constructor for FilteredElementCollector taking a document and view id. This allows you to use filtering and LINQ queries against the el...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Replacement for 3 structural enums - The enumerated types
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Replacement for AnalyticalModel - The class hierarchy for accessing the structural analytical model has been replaced. The new class hierarchy offers a more streamlined interface and more capabilities to read data and modify analytica...

0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Parameter API changes - Provides access to filter elements associated to views. You can access and modify the categories associated to a filter and the rules associated to a filter. You can also create new filters using an i...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Alignment and ItemFactoryBase.NewAlignment() - The Alignment element subclass has been removed. NewAlignment() and element iteration will now return alignments as Dimension elements.

0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Floor slope and elevation - The slope and elevation at a point on floor's surface can be found using the methods:

0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Keyboard shortcut support for API buttons - API buttons found on the Ribbon can be assigned a keyboard shortcut. Buttons created by applications registered using manifest files now use an id based on their application id and button name to prov...
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - MEP API - The properties
0902 - What's New in Revit 2011 API - Structural API - The Autodesk.Revit.Creation.Document.NewTruss method, which was previously only enabled in Revit Structure, is now also enabled in Revit Architecture.
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Unexpected Places, and Warmer - ﻿

0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - AnalyticalModel now an Element - The AnalyticalModel class is now a subclass of Element.
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - AnalyticalModelSelector - The following two constructors were removed from AnalyticalModelSelector:
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - SlabFoundationType - The enumerated value SlabFoundationType.Slab is now SlabFoundationType.SlabOneWay. A new option, SlabTwoWay, is also available. Existing floors assigned the value Slab will report SlabOneWay.

0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Element.Geometry - This property has been modified to throw an exception when attempting to read the geometry of a newly added or modified element, if the element has not yet been regenerated. Call Document.Regenerate()...
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - GeometryObject.GraphicsStyleId - This new property allows access to the GraphicsStyle and Category of individual family primitives to be determined while working in the project environment.

0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Serialization/deserialization of References - The new methods
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Face.HasRegions & Face.GetRegions() - This property and method provide information about the faces created by the Split Face command. HasRegions returns a boolean indicating if the face has any Split Face regions. GetRegions returns a lis...
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Face.MaterialElementId replaces Face.MaterialElement - Face.MaterialElement has been obsoleted. Face.MaterialElementId should be used instead.
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - NewHermiteSpline tangency control - A new overload takes optional XYZ inputs for the tangency at the start and end of the spline.

0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - PolyLine returned from Element.Geometry - A new geometry object called a PolyLine is exposed through the API. The PolyLine represents a set of coordinate points forming contiguous line segments. Typically this type of geometry would be seen i...
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Pipe settings and sizes - The following new classes provide read/write access to MEP pipe settings:
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Placeholder ducts and pipes - The following new properties identify placeholder ducts and pipes:
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Duct & pipe insulation & lining - The new classes
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - VSTA enabled for multiple Revit sessions - Macros can now be used in multiple Revit sessions launched from a single installation. Revit will no longer warn you about VSTA being disabled when the second and subsequent sessions are launched.
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Track Changes UI - The track changes UI previously offered by Revit Structure has been removed. In previous releases, this offered the ability to highlight elements changed by API commands, and a limited ability to reve...
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - LineLoad.UniformLoad - This property has been corrected to be Boolean instead of integer.
---
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - NewBeamSystem() changes - The family of NewBeamSystem() methods has changed. Previously curves could be input without a sketch plane or level as input, and the orientation of the active view would determine the orientation of ...
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - NewTruss() change - The SketchPlane input for this method is now required. Previously null could be input, and the orientation of the active view would determine the orientation of the resultant truss.
---
0903 - What's New in Revit 2012 API - Rebar changes - RebarShape elements are no longer modifiable (except for Allowed Bar Types).
Instead of changing a RebarShape, create a new one based on the old one.
This change results in a simplified API that works...

0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ElementArray and ElementSet are now obsolete - ﻿
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Definitions and DefinitionGroups - These classes used to inherit from base classes consisting of old-style Revit API collections. The new versions of the classes offer the same functionality, but implement System.Collections.Generic.IE...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - GeometryElement.Objects - The property
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Idling event frequency - The Idling event has been changed to offer two different modes of behavior. The default behavior has changed; pre-existing code that needs the original behavior will need to opt-in to the non-default ...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Idling event with no active document - The Idling event now is invoked when there is no document active in Revit.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - External Events framework - The External Events framework is a new API framework tailored for asynchronous processing such as that which is needed to support modeless dialogs. It operates similarly to the Idling event with defau...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Calling OpenAndActivateDocument during events - The UIApplication.OpenAndActivateDocument can now be invoked during events under the following conditions:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Worksharing properties - The information required to identify a workshared file on the central or local locations have changed due to changes to RevitServer. As a result, the members
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - New overloads for Application.OpenDocumentFile() - The new overloads support parameters OpenOptions and OpenOptionsForUI, respectively, to specify how a Revit document should be opened. Both options classes currently offer the ability to detach the op...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - BasicFileInfo - The new class
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Free() - Unlike other Point Cloud interfaces in the Revit 2012 release, this interface did not offer a method to be called when Revit is finished with it.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - GetOffset() - Implement this method to return the offset stored in the point cloud. All points are assumed to be offset by the same offset vector. The offset should be expressed in the same units as used by the poi...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - CreatePointSetIterator() - A second overload with an additional argument – density – the desired number of points per unit area. Area is computed in native units of the point cloud.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Rebar.GetCenterlineCurves() - The overload taking one argument is now obsolete.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Rebar member changes - These members are now obsolete:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - AreaReinforcement and PathReinforcement - The new RebarInSystem element replaces the BarDescription class. This class and related methods:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ConnectorProfileType, PartType - ConnectorProfileType enums are renamed to:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ConnectorElement - Subclasses of ConnectorElement: PipeConnector, DuctConnector, and ElectricalConnector, are obsolete.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Classes removed - - MaterialConcrete, MaterialGeneric, MaterialOther, MaterialSteel, MaterialWood – all data is now accessed via the Material class- Autodesk.Revit.DB.ConstructionType – replaced by Autodesk.DB.Analysis...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Methods and properties removed - - AnalysisDisplayLegend.Width – replaced by legend settings of AnalysisDisplayStyle.- AnalysisDisplayLegendSettings.SetTextTypeId(ElementId, Document)- AnalysisDisplayMarkersAndTextSettings.SetTextTyp...

0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Stairs annotations - The new class
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - View Creation - Plan Views can now be created with the new ViewPlan.Create(document, viewFamilyTypeId, levelId) method.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - DisplayStyle - The enum DisplayStyle (with values including Wireframe, HLR, and Shading) has been added so the API can be used to get/set the new DisplayStyle property.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ViewDetailLevel - The enum ViewDetailLevel (with values Coarse, Medium, and Fine) has been added with get/set access to the new DetailLevel property.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ViewRange - The view range for plan views can now be retrieved via ViewPlan.GetViewRange().
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - 3D View Locking - - 3D Views can now be locked and unlocked via the API with the methods SaveOrientationAndLock, RestoreOrientationAndLock, and Unlock.- The property IsLocked indicates if a view is currently locked.- N...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - View.Duplicate - Views can now be duplicated via the API with the View.Duplicate(ViewDuplicateOption) method.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - UIView class and UIDocument.GetOpenUIViews() - The UIView class has been added to represent a view window in the Revit user interface. GetOpenUIViews provides a list of all open views. UIView.GetWindowRectangle() returns a rectangle that describes...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Pan and Zoom - The method
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - PlanViewDirection - The enum PlanViewDirection has been added so API can be used to get/set the view direction to either Up or Down for StructuralPlan views.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ViewFamilyType class and ViewFamily enum - The ViewFamilyType class has been created to correspond to the Types seen in the UI's Properties dialog for each view. The ViewFamily enum (FloorPlan, Section, Legend, etc) specifies the family of the...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Temporary view modes - View.EnableRevealHiddenMode, View.EnableTemporaryAnalyticalDisplayMode, View.DisableTemporaryViewMode, and the TemporaryViewMode Enumeration have been added to allow control of temporary view modes.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Schedule API - Several new classses have been added to allow schedule views to be created, modified, and added to drawing sheets. Major new classes include:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Running API commands in Schedule Views - API commands may now be active when a Schedule is active in the current document.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Schedule export - The ViewSchedule class has been added to the API and the method ViewSchedule.Export method exports an existing schedule to a text file.

0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Support for Keyboard Shortcuts and Quick Access - API commands may now be assigned keyboard shortcuts, and those assignments will be preserved even if add-ins are added, removed or changed in subsequent sessions.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Replace implementation of commands - It provides ability to replace the existing Revit command (located in any tab, application menu and right-click menus) implementation with add-in routine.

0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - SelectionFilterElement - The new class
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Ceiling, Floor and CeilingAndFloor - The newly exposed Ceiling class represents a ceiling in Revit. It inherits from CeilingAndFloor. The Floor class has been modified to also inherit from CeilingAndFloor.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Split volumes - The new method:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Solid tessellation - The new method:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Face.Triangulate() - A new overload to Face.Triangulate() accepts a level of detail as an argument. Levels of detail close to 0 (the minimum) will result in coarser triangulations than levels of detail close to 1 (the max...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Ellipse \u2013 axes - The new properties:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - GeometryElement.GetBoundingBox() - This new method provides read access to the bounding box of a given geometry element.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - ItemFactoryBase.NewAlignment() - This method can now align a line and a reference plane as well as all other geometry types from previous versions.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - CylindricalHelix curve type - A new subclass of Curve has been introduced: CylindricalHelix. The class offers methods useful for reading and creating such curves.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - CurveLoop as IEnumerable<Curve> - The members of a CurveLoop can now be traversed, as CurveLoop implements IEnumerable<Curve>.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - CurveElement \u2013 center point reference - The new property:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - NewSketchPlane(Document, Reference) - This new overload for NewSketchPlane in the ItemFactoryBase class supports creation of a sketch plane directly from a Reference representing a planar face.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - MultiSegmentGrid class - This class has been added to the API to support multi-segment grids.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Grid geometry - Element.Geometry now supports Grids and MultiSegmentGrids, including the ability to see gaps and extents applied to the grid lines to form different segments.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Diameter dimensions - Revit now supports Diameter dimensions. The DimensionShape enumeration contains a new Diameter member. And there is a new creation method for diameter dimensions:
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - DimensionSegment overrides - There are several new properties on DimensionSegment to override text properties.
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Detail element draw order - The class
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - SpatialElementCalculationPoint - This class provides access to the "Room or Space Calculation Point" seen in families. The Spatial Element Calculation Point is graphically showed as a location point marker with a "snake" line from th...
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - RPC content assets - The AssetType enum now contains a value "Content", which can be used to enumerate the loaded RPC content assets in the Revit session.
---
0904 - What's New in Revit 2013 API - Family.PlacementType - This new property provides information about the placement type for instances of the given family. PlacementType roughly maps to the overloads of NewFamilyInstance.

0937 - Compiling the Revit 2014 SDK - Here are some notes on the small issues I encountered compiling the Revit 2014 SDK:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - What's New in the Revit 2014 API - ﻿
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Document.Save() - Several modifications have been made to the Document.Save() methods.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Document.SaveAs() - Several modifications have been made to the Document.SaveAs() functions.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - OpenOptions - New options are available in this class:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Application.OpenDocumentFile(ModelPath, OpenOptions) - This method has been reimplemented.  While the signature has not changed, there are new options available to be set in OpenOptions.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Application.OpenDocumentFile(String) - This method has been reimplemented.  While the signature has not changed, failures are now signaled with specific documented exceptions.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - UIApplication.OpenAndActivateDocument(ModelPath, - The signature and the implementation of this method has changed.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - UIApplication.OpenAndActivateDocument(String) - This method has been reimplemented.  Failures are now signaled with specific documented exceptions.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Iteration and element deletion - When an element is deleted active iterations over the document (via FilteredElementCollector) are now stopped. A new InvalidOperationException is thrown.  The iterator cannot proceed due to changes ma...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Materials - Materials applied with the Paint tool and their areas can be found by specifying "true" for the 'usePaintMaterial' argumement in Element.GetMaterialIds and Element.GetMaterialArea
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - FreeForm element - A FreeFormElement is a form sub-type that contains non-parametric geometry created from an input solid outline. The element can be added to families, and can participate in joins and void cuts with ot...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Solid & curve intersection - The new method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Face/Face Intersection - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - ReferenceIntersector & RVT Links - The new option findReferencesInRevitLinks allows ReferenceIntersector to find geometry in RVT links.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Rulings of RuledFace - The new method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Detail element draw order - The class
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - StairsRunJustification - New values LeftExterior and RightExterior have been added to this enum to support jusitification to the left and right supports.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - StairsLanding - The new members:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - StairsRun - The new properties:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Curve creation - New curve creation methods have been added as statics on the associated curve type:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - StairsComponentConnection - The new methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Parameter.AsValueString() - This method previously was implemented for only Integer and Double values. It now can also be used with Enums and ElementIds. Optionally it can accept a FormatOptions object to specify units formattin...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Parameter.Definition.UnitType - This new property provides access to the UnitType of a parameter definition.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Parameter variance among group instances - The new members:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - FilterCategoryRule - The new class FilterCategoryRule can be used in the definition of a ParameterFilterElement.   It represents a filter rule that matches elements of a set of categories.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - ThermalAsset.SpecificHeat - This new property provides the specific heat value of a thermal asset in feet per Kelvin, squared-second.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - AreaVolumeSettings - This new class provides access to settings related to volume and area computations. The old VolumeCalculationSetting class is obsolete.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Document.Delete() - This method previously returned null if the element or elements could not be deleted. It now will throw an exception in this situation.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Document level updaters - The new methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - UIThemeManager - The static properties of UIThemeManager provide access to the current UI theme and the default theme.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Curve utilities - The new methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Family category - The property
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - SpatialElementCalculationLocation - The class SpatialElementCalculationLocation is used to specify the room or space where an element should be considered as placed.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - SpatialElementFromToCalculationPoints - SpatialElementFromToCalculationPoints is a subclass of SpatialElementCalculationLocation used to specify the search points for a family instance that connects two rooms or spaces, such as a door or wi...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Arc through points - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - DocumentChangedEventArgs - For the methods GetAddedElementIds()/GetModifiedElementIds() – internal Revit element ids that are not visible to UI and API are now excluded from the return set.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - GetAddElementIds(ElementFilter)/GetModifiedElementIds(ElementFilter) - The new methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Reinforcement Length Tolerance - The new classes:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Edge utilities - The new methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Transform initialization - The new methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Unit Formatting and Parsing - The methods:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Unit Conversion - The new class UnitUtils contains methods to convert between unit types:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Viewport.Create behavioral change - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - View.ViewName obsolete - The property
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - View.SetVisibility() - The name of this method has now been correctly capitalized.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - ViewSchedule changes - ViewSchedule is now a child of TableView.   All previously existing ViewSchedule API is still valid, but TableView also brings in a set of APIs related to:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Applying visual materials - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - AssetProperty changes - AssetProperty no longer inherits from APIObject.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - External commands now supported from Project - API commands and macros are now enabled when the Revit active view is the Project Browser.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Start/End Extension & Cutback - There are new extension and cutback parameters assigned to Beam and Brace elements.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Justifications - There are new justification parameters assigned to Beam and Brace elements.
The new set of parameters provides more options to manipulate the physical element in relation to its analytical curve.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Divided Surface API - The class DividedSurfaceData and the associated method Element.GetDividedSurfaceData() have been replaced.  The new methods to access DividedSurfaces applied to elements are:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - PointCloudType.Create() - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - PointCloudInstance.GetPoints() - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Point cloud overrides - The classes
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Point cloud scans - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - IFC export now External Service - The capability to override IFC export is now managed as an External Service.  As such, the explicit interfaces in ExporterIFCRegistry are no longer needed and have been marked obsolete.  It is now pos...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - IFC APIs moved to new assembly - Most IFC API classes have been moved from RevitAPI.dll to a new assembly: RevitAPIIFC.dll. The classes moved include all members of the Autodesk.Revit.DB.IFC namespace which enable development of a cu...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - PrintParameters - The property HideUnreferencedViewTages was renamed to HideUnreferencedViewTags.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Classes removed - - CurtainCellSetIterator and CurtainCellSet – Use generic .NET collection classes instead.
- PipeMaterialType – replaced by Material
- Batch creation argument class types – batch creation is not neede...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Methods and Properties removed - - NewMaterialSet() – replaced by .net Generic collection classes
- NewElementArray() – replaced by .net Generic collection classes

0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Non-rectangular crop region - Views can now be assigned a crop region which is non-rectangular.  The new View members:

0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Dockable Dialog Panes - Revit now allows addins to register WPF dialogs to dock into the top, left, right, and bottom of the main Revit window, as well as to be added as a tab to an existing system pane, such as the project ...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Multi-reference annotations for rebar - Revit now supports annotations pointing to more than one reference, consisting of a dimension and associated tag These annotations can be used to label and dimension Rebar elements, and are labeled in...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Dimension alternate units - New properties of DimensionStyle provide access to alternate units settings:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Dimension unit type - The property:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Automatic load of add-ins without restarting - Revit now automatically loads addins from newly added .addin manifest files without restarting Revit.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - MacroManager API - Revit now support an API for listing, creating, removing, editing, debugging, and running macros through several supporting classes and enums
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Macro Attributes - The attributes
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Shared parameter \u2013 create with specified\ - The new method

0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Family Parameters - The new property
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - JoinGeometryUtils - Revit now supports APIs for joining, unjoining, querying join state, and changing join order of elements in a model through the JoinGeometryUtils class.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - ExtensibleStorage API changes - The method
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - ExtensibleStorageFilter - An ExtensibleStorageFilter is a new ElementQuickFilter for finding elements that contain an extensible storage entity of a given Schema Guid.

0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - SiteSubRegion - The class SiteSubRegion represents a proxy class exposing the interfaces needed to access details of a subregion.   In the Revit database, both TopographySurface elements and subregion elements are re...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - BuildingPad - The class BuildingPad represents a building pad element in Revit.  It inherits from CeilingAndFloor and thus offers inherited capabilities from HostObject as well. The API exposes the following specif...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Externalized Calculations - Several new interfaces and classes based on external services are supported for pipe and duct calculations.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - ElectricalLoadClassificationData - ElectricalLoadClassificationData has several new string properties corresponding to the load classification section of the electrical panel schedule.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - CSV Fitting Parameter Removal - Because CSV files are no longer used to drive MEP fitting parameters, Revit supports a new set of APIs to manage fitting parameters through several classes
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Fitting Angle Settings - The members:
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Duct Settings - Duct settings for size prefixes and suffixes, annotations, and  air density and viscosity may now be set through the DuctSettings class.
---
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Curve Creation - Pipes, Ducts,  FlexPipes, and FlexDucts can now be created with a  Pipe, Duct, FlexPipe, or FlexDuct SystemTypeId as a parameter on their respective static Create() methods.

0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - CustomExporter - A class that allows exporting 3D views via a custom export context. The Export method of this class triggers standard rendering process in Revit, but instead of displaying the result on screen or prin...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - IExportContext - An interface of which interface is used in a custom export of a Revit model. The instance of this class is passed in as a parameter of a CustomExporter. The methods are then called by Revit at times o...
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - Render Node Classes - Classes of which instance are sent to an export context during a custom export.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - CameraInfo - A class that describes information about projection mapping of a 3D view to a rendered image. An instance of this class can be obtained via a property of ViewNode.
0938 - Major Changes and Renovations - No transactions from outside threads - Calling into the Revit API from outside threads and outside modeless dialogs has never been supported, but it was not strictly prohibited, meaning there would be no immediate exceptions when someone t...

1141 - API Changes - What's New in the Revit 2015 API - I wanted to publish the 'What's New' section of the Revit 2015 API help file right away after the release of Revit 2015 and was caught up in too many other things.
Here it is, at last.
1141 - API Changes - Major changes and renovations to the Revit API - This document consists of three main sections, on changes affecting existing add-ins, major new functionality, and minor enhancements.
1141 - API Changes - Element.Parameter[String] - The indexed property Element.Parameter[String] is obsolete. The recommended replacement is:
1141 - API Changes - Element.Parameters - The collection returned from this property now includes more parameters. Previously, it returned only parameters that Revit showed in the Properties Palette, but now it also includes parameters availa...
1141 - API Changes - Shared parameter creation \u2013 description and user modifiability - Revit now allows the assignment of two new properties to shared parameters:
1141 - API Changes - WorksetConfiguration methods - The methods
1141 - API Changes - SynchronizeWithCentralOptions.CompactCentralFile - The property
1141 - API Changes - FamilyBase class removed - The FamilyBase class has been completely removed as a base class of Family. Family now inherits directly from Element. The members which belonged to FamilyBase have moved to Family:
1141 - API Changes - Family.Symbols - The property Family.Symbols has been obsoleted – use
1141 - API Changes - Family.CurtainPanelHorizontalSpacing and Family.CurtainPanelVerticalSpacing - Access to these properties is now supported only from an owner family obtained from a curtain panel family document.
1141 - API Changes - View display settings - The new class:
1141 - API Changes - ViewSheet members related to Revisions - Several ViewSheet methods related to Revisions have been replaced with new names. The original members have been obsoleted. This table lists the changes:
1141 - API Changes - AnalyticalModel members obsoleted - Several methods of AnalyticalModel have been marked obsolete:
1141 - API Changes - AreaReinforcement API changes - The method
1141 - API Changes - PathReinforcement API changes - A new overload has been introduced for
1141 - API Changes - FabricArea API changes - The method
1141 - API Changes - RebarHookType API changes - The method
1141 - API Changes - Miscellaneous changes - The following classes:
1141 - API Changes - Connector properties removed - The properties
1141 - API Changes - Creation.Document.NewWire() - The method NewWire() has been obsoleted and replaced by the new method
1141 - API Changes - Related Wire API additions - Several new methods have been introduced to edit the layout of an existing wire:
1141 - API Changes - Obsoleted functions, classes, and enums - - The IFCDoorStyleOperation and IFCWindowStyleOperation enums have been obsoleted and replaced entirely by their .NET equivalents.
- IFCExporterUtils.GetWallHeightDirection is no longer necessary, as ...
1141 - API Changes - Changed functions, classes, and enums - Several API routines that returned HashSet<IFCAnyHandle> now return an ICollection<IFCAnyHandle> instead.
---
1141 - API Changes - New functions, classes, and enums - IFCFile has a new Read() function that returns the number of errors and warnings reported by the toolkit during the read operation. This is in addition to the existing Read() function.
1141 - API Changes - ElementId properties in EnergyAnaysisDetailModel contents - The properties:
1141 - API Changes - Material API - The property Material.MaterialCagtegory has been obsoleted and replaced by Material.MaterialCategory.
---
1141 - API Changes - TableSectionData.InsertColumn(int index, bool bCreateCellData) - This method has been obsoleted – use
1141 - API Changes - BoundaryConditions - This class has moved from namespace Autodesk.Revit.DB to Autodesk.Revit.DB.Structure.
---
1141 - API Changes - BuiltInCategory.OST\_MassWindow - This enumerated type value has been renamed to OST\_MassGlazing.
---
1141 - API Changes - ElementIntersectsElementFilter - Previously, the ElementIntersectsElementFilter would report the target element as an "intersection" with itself. This behavior has been changed; the filter will no longer pass the target element.
---
1141 - API Changes - ExtensibleStorageFilter - The ExtensibleStorageFilter class has moved from namespace Autodesk.Revit.DB to Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.
---
1141 - API Changes - MeshTriangle - The MeshTriangle class no longer inherits from APIObject.
---
1141 - API Changes - CurtainGridLine.Move() - The method CurtainGridLine.Move() has been obsoleted. Use ElementTransformUtils.MoveElement() to accomplish the same result.
---
1141 - API Changes - CurveLoop.CreateViaThicken() - Previously, when this function couldn't create a compatible CurveLoop, it would return null. It now throws an exception in this situation.
1141 - API Changes - Active graphical view - The new property
1141 - API Changes - Sketchy lines settings - The new methods
1141 - API Changes - Family Types - These members provide read and write access to the default type for a given family category id:
1141 - API Changes - Non-family Types - These members provide read and write access to the default type for a non-Family element type:
1141 - API Changes - Reinforcement numbering - The new classes:
1141 - API Changes - Reinforcement in parts - Reinforcement and Rebar is now allowed to be hosted in Parts if those Parts come from a structural layer of a valid reinforcement host.
1141 - API Changes - Rebar presentation mode - The new presentation mode capabilities allow the user to specify how rebar sets are shown in a given view. Bar presentation schemes simplify the view while maintaining an identifiable footprint in whi...
1141 - API Changes - Place FabricSheet directly in host - The new members:
1141 - API Changes - Creating default reinforcement types - The new methods:
1141 - API Changes - Miscellaneous reinforcement API additions - The new overloads:
1141 - API Changes - AnalyticalModel API additions - The new method:
1141 - API Changes - Loads and Boundary Conditions API - The new properties:
1141 - API Changes - StructuralFramingUtils - The methods:
1141 - API Changes - RevisionSettings class - The new RevisionSettings class allows an application to read and modify the project-wide settings that affect Revisions and Revision Clouds.
1141 - API Changes - Revision class - The new Revision class allows an application to read and modify the existing revisions in a project and also to create new revisions. Revision is a subclass of element.
1141 - API Changes - RevisionCloud class - The new RevisionCloud class allows an application to access information about the revision clouds that are present within a model and to create new revision clouds.
1141 - API Changes - Revision cloud geometry - The property:
1141 - API Changes - Parameter order - Revit now allows users to reorder parameters within their groups for a given family, ensuring that the parameters are presented to the user in the most logical order. Several API changes have been int...
1141 - API Changes - Family parameter creation \u2013 description - The new method:
1141 - API Changes - Stacked wall - Several new members added to the Wall class provide support for reading information about stacked wall and stacked wall members.
1141 - API Changes - Wall Function - The new property
1141 - API Changes - Schedule filters - As schedules now support up to 8 applied filters, the following methods now allow up to 8 filters to be applied:
1141 - API Changes - ScheduleDefinition.GrandTotalTitle - The new property
1141 - API Changes - Images in schedules - Images can now be added to schedules via parameters defined as type "Image". In schedule views, the image parameter will display the path of the ImageType, but the image itself displays in ScheduleShe...
1141 - API Changes - IFC import options and operations - The new method:
1141 - API Changes - ImporterIFC new properties and functions - ImporterIFC offers new members to assist with the implementation of custom IFC importers:
1141 - API Changes - Built-in parameter changes - BuiltInParameter.IFC\_\*\_GUID values (IFC\_GUID, IFC\_TYPE\_GUID, IFC\_PROJECT\_GUID, IFC\_BUILDING\_GUID, and IFC\_SITE\_GUID) are no longer required to be unique, and are schedulable.
1141 - API Changes - DirectShape - The new classes:
1141 - API Changes - TessellatedShapeBuilder - The new classes:
1141 - API Changes - IExternalResourceServer - The new interface:
1141 - API Changes - IExternalResourceUIServer - The new interface:
1141 - API Changes - ExternalResourceReference - The new class:
1141 - API Changes - KeyBasedTreeEntryTable - The new class:
1141 - API Changes - KeyBasedTreeEntry - The class:
1141 - API Changes - gbXML export options - The new property:
1141 - API Changes - BuildingEnvelopeAnalyzer Class - The new class:
1141 - API Changes - Document.IsDetached - The new property
1141 - API Changes - Document.DocumentWorksharingEnabled - This event is raised when Revit has just enabled worksharing in the document. Handlers of this event are permitted to make modifications to any document (including the active document), except for doc...
1141 - API Changes - UIDocument operations and additions - The new method
1141 - API Changes - External Resource compatibility - The Revit Link API has been updated – all methods which took a ModelPath argument now have new versions which take an ExternalResourceReference argument. These methods can also work with files from di...
1141 - API Changes - RevitLinkType.AttachmentType - This property is now writable, and can be toggled between Attachment and Overlay.
1141 - API Changes - Category.CategoryType - The new property
1141 - API Changes - ElementType.FamilyName - The new property
1141 - API Changes - ElementType duplicating events - The events:
1141 - API Changes - View.IsAssemblyView - The new property
1141 - API Changes - View.Title - The new property
1141 - API Changes - Categories hidden status - The following properties are now settable:
1141 - API Changes - Drafting view creation - The new method
1141 - API Changes - Orient 3D view - The new method
1141 - API Changes - Reference callouts and sections - The new class ReferenceableViewUtils provides utility methods that allow an application to manage reference views such as reference sections or reference callouts.
1141 - API Changes - FamilyManager.IsUserAssignableParameterGroup - The new method
1141 - API Changes - LocationPoint.Rotation for view-specific family instances - The property:
1141 - API Changes - PromptForFamilyInstancePlacement() option for Air Terminals on - The new overload method
1141 - API Changes - Family loading events - The events:

1601 - Delete Global Param - `
from Autodesk.Revit.DB import *
doc = __revit__.ActiveUIDocument.Document
id = GlobalParametersManager.FindByName(doc,'Test')
t = Transaction(doc)
t.Start('delete gp')
doc.Delete(id)
t.Commit()
`

1740 - API Changes - What's New in the Revit 2020 API - * 1. API Changes
1740 - API Changes - 2.2.1. ImageType API - The new members:
- ImageType.Create(Document, ImageTypeOptions)
- ImageType.CanReload()
- ImageType.ReloadFrom(ImageTypeOptions)
- ImageType.ExternalResourceType
- ImageType.PageNumber
- ImageType.Pat...
1740 - API Changes - 2.2.2. ImageInstance API - The new class
- ImageInstance
represents an image placed in a view. It includes:
- ImageInstance.Create(Document, View, ElementId, ImagePlacementOptions)
- ImageInstance.GetLocation(BoxPlacement)
- Im...
1740 - API Changes - 2.3.1. Setting filters - The new function:
- ElementLogicalFilter.SetFilters()
allows setting ElementFilters that are combined by the given ElementLogicalFilter. This allows an easier method to modify the filter criteria stor...
1740 - API Changes - 2.4.1. Journal playback - The new function:
- Application.IsJournalPlaying()
determines if Revit is currently in journal playback mode or not.
1740 - API Changes - 2.5.1. Add Animated Progress Bar to a TaskDialog - The new property:
- TaskDialog.EnableMarqueeDialogBar
allows the TaskDialog to include a progress bar that has an indeterminate start and stop. The animation continues until the TaskDialog is closed.
...
1740 - API Changes - 2.5.2. Specify minimum width and height for a DockablePane - Minimum width and height can now be set for a DockablePane:
- Autodesk.Revit.UI.DockablePaneState.MinimumWidth
- Autodesk.Revit.UI.DockablePaneState.MinimumHeight
These are specified as part of the In...
1740 - API Changes - 2.6.1. Returning cloud model information for cloud workshared - The new property:
- Document.IsModelInCloud
indicates if the current document is located in cloud.
- Document.CloudModelGUID
returns the GUID of the model, if it is stored in the cloud.
The new method...
1740 - API Changes - 2.6.2. Open/Save/Modify cloud models on BIM 360 - The new method:
- Document.SaveAsCloudModel()
saves the current model as a cloud model in BIM 360. Only non-workshared models can be saved via this method.
The new method:
- Document.SaveCloudModel()
...
1740 - API Changes - 2.6.3. Identifying if background calculations are underway - The new method:
- Document.IsBackgroundCalculationInProgress()
identifies if there are any background calculations in progress for this document. When a document has background calculations in progres...
1740 - API Changes - 2.7.1. Category visibility - The new property:
- Category.IsVisibleInUI
returns true if the category should be visible to the user in lists of categories in the Revit user interface (dialogs such as Visibility Graphics or View Fi...
1740 - API Changes - 2.7.2. Get string names of categories - The new method:
- LabelUtils.GetLabelFor (BuiltInCategory)
returns the string name of the given BuiltInCategory in the current Revit language.
1740 - API Changes - 2.8.1. Getting localized parameter names - The new method:
- LabelUtils.GetLabelFor(BuiltInParameter, Autodesk.Revit.ApplicationServices.LanguageType)
returns the localized string name representing the built-in parameter in the input language....
1740 - API Changes - 2.8.2. Hiding empty parameters - The new property
- ExternalDefinition.HideWhenNoValue
Indicates if the shared parameter should be hidden from the property palette and Element.GetOrderedParameters() when it has no value.
Similar func...
1740 - API Changes - 2.8.3. Filtering by presence or absence of parameter value - The new filter classes:
- ParameterValuePresenceRule
- HasValueFilterRule
- HasNoValueFilterRule
define filter rules evaluating whether or not a parameter has a value for a specific element.
Use the s...
1740 - API Changes - 2.9.1. CurveLoop API - The new property:
- CurveLoop.NumberOfCurves
returns the number of curves in the curve loop.
The new method:
- CurveLoop.CreateViaOffset()
creates a new curve loop that is an offset of the existing cu...
1740 - API Changes - 2.10.1. View Template API additions - The new methods:
- View.CreateViewTemplate()
- View.isViewValidForTemplateCreation()
allow you to turn an existing view into a view template. The created view template has an automatically generated u...
1740 - API Changes - 2.10.2. View Filter API additions - Validation restrictions for the ElementFilter stored by a ParameterFilterElement (the class that represents a View Filter) has been relaxed to enable more flexible creation of OR filters where criteri...
1740 - API Changes - 2.12.1. TopographySurface additions - The new method:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.TopographySurface.Create(Document, IList points, IList< IList > facets, String)
creates a topography surface from a given list of triangulation facets....
1740 - API Changes - 2.12.2. TopographyLinkType additions - The new class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.TopographyLinkType
represents a site file brought into the current Revit model as a link.
The new method:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.Architecture.TopographyLin...
1740 - API Changes - 2.13.1. SiteLocation addition - The new method:
- SiteLocation.SetGeoCoordinateSystem()
sets the Geo coordinate system for the current document.
---

- BasePoint.Position
gets the XYZ value corresponding to the base point's position in Revit's internal coordinates.

- BasePoint.SharedPosition
g...
1740 - API Changes - 2.14.1. Part creation from DirectShapes - Parts can now be created from DirectShape instances, either in the same host document or in a link. Since various reasons might prevent parts from being created from an element, the new methods
- Dire...

- PartUtils.GetSplittingCurves(Document, ElementId)
- PartUtils.GetSplittingCurves(Document, ElementId, out SketchPlane)
identify and return the curves that were sketched to create th...
1740 - API Changes - 2.15.1. BalusterInfo reference name - The new functions:
- BalusterInfo.GetReferenceNameForHost()
- BalusterInfo.GetReferenceNameForTopRail()
allow access to the name string to be used as a reference to either the Host or Top Rail in the ...
1740 - API Changes - 2.16.1. CustomExporter now supports some 2D views - The class CustomExporter can now export 2D views. The only 2D view types supported at this time are plans, sections and elevations. The new method:
- CustomExporter.Export()
accepts either a 3D or 2D ...
1740 - API Changes - 2.16.2. New Navisworks export options - Three new options have been added to the class NavisworksExportOptions:
- NavisworksExportOptions.FacetingFactor
- NavisworksExportOptions.ConvertLights
- NavisworksExportOptions.ConvertLinkedCADForma...
1740 - API Changes - 2.17.1. Additional References - MultiReferenceAnnotations can now pick additional references from the model. The following new methods support this:
- MultiReferenceAnnotationOptions.SetAdditionalReferencesToDimension()
- MultiRefer...
1740 - API Changes - 2.17.2. 3D view placement restrictions - The new method:
- MultiReferenceAnnotation.Is3DViewValidForDimension()
is used by MultiReferenceAnnotation.Create() to verify that the dimension is valid for the view. LinearFixed dimensions cannot be...
1740 - API Changes - 2.18.1. Glazing schema API - To assist in creating code accessing and manipulating the properties of a given schema, predefined properties have been introduced to allow a compile-time reference to a property name without requirin...
1740 - API Changes - 2.19.1. Path of Travel API - The new class:

- RebarConstraint.IsReferenceValidForConstraint()

1903 - API Changes - What's New in the Revit 2022 API - * 1 API Changes
1903 - API Changes - 1.1.1. Changes to Parameter Access APIs - - Original member → Preferred replacement
- Document.TypeOfStorage[BuiltInParameter] → Document.GetTypeOfStorage(ForgeTypeId)
- Element.Parameter[BuiltInParameter] → Element.GetParameter(ForgeTypeId)
...
1903 - API Changes - 1.1.2. Changes to Parameter Definition APIs - In the Definition class, the ParameterType property and the GetSpecTypeId() method are both deprecated in favor of the new method GetDataType(). GetDataType() is more general than the functions it rep...
1903 - API Changes - 1.1.3. Changes to Shared Parameter Creation and Binding APIs - In the ExternalDefinitionCreationOptions class, used to create shared parameters, the implementation now offers better input validation and new capabilities.
The deprecated class constructor and Type ...
1903 - API Changes - 1.1.4. Changes to GlobalParameter APIs - - Deprecated member → Replacement member
- GlobalParameter.Create(Document, string, ParameterType) → GlobalParameter.Create(Document, string, ForgeTypeId)
- GlobalParameter.IsValidDataType(ParameterTy...
1903 - API Changes - 1.1.5. New and changed utility APIs - The LabelUtils class, used to obtain user-visible names for enumerations, has several changes according to the mapping from enumerations to ForgeTypeId. In addition to the replacements listed below, a...
1903 - API Changes - 1.3.1. SaveAsCloudModel() now supports save of a new Revit Cloud - The method:
- Document.SaveAsCloudModel(Guid, Guid, String, String)
has been enhanced to support upload of local workshared file into BIM 360 Design as a Revit Cloud Worksharing central model.
In addi...

- RevitLinkType.Create(Document, ModelPath, RevitLinkOptions)
- RevitLinkType.LoadFrom(ModelPath, WorksetConfiguration)
have been enhanced to support creation of new cloud model Revit lin...
1903 - API Changes - 1.3.3. Worksharing API exception changes - Several exceptions have changed from existing worksharing API. For the method Document.SaveAsCloudModel():
- Situation → Previous exception → Current exception
- User doesn't sign in → ArgumentExcepti...
1903 - API Changes - 1.3.4. Worksharing API replacements - Some properties have been removed and replaced in this release. Because these were an immediate replacement, applications referencing the replaced properties will need to be updated immediately for th...
1903 - API Changes - 1.4.1. Floor creation API replacements - The following members have been replaced:
- Deprecated member → Replacement member
- Autodesk.Revit.Creation.Document.NewFloor() (all overloads) → Floor.Create(Document document, IList profile, Elemen...
1903 - API Changes - 1.5.1. Rotation - The new property
- RotationAngle
can be used to get or set the rotation of the tag relative to its view.
---
1903 - API Changes - 1.5.2. Multiple References - IndependentTag now supports multiple references to various elements or sub-elements.
A number of properties were deprecated. The users can now access the desired leader or tagged element using their R...
1903 - API Changes - 1.8.1. Import() and Link() methods now treat View as optional - The methods:
- Document.Import()
- Document.Link()
that take a View as an argument have been updated to accept null for that argument. This applies to all overloads of these methods except those that ...

1903 - API Changes - 1.9.1. Electrical API changes - The following method and property have been deprecated; the old methods referred to temperature in terms on "long", which did not match the capabilities in the UI, and had an error when referring to n...
1903 - API Changes - 1.9.2. Fabrication API changes - In a terminology change, the fabrication service "group" was renamed as a "palette" in order to align with changes made in the Revit user interface. This affected the following members:
- Deprecated A...

- Wall.RemoveProfileSketch()
- Wall.CanHaveProfileSketch()

1903 - API Changes - 2.1.4. Slanted and Tapered Walls - The new members:
- Wall.CrossSection
- Wall.IsWallCrossSectionValid()
allow assignment of a cross section type to a given wall, and determine if that type can be assigned.

- Auto...

- Ceiling.SketchId
- Floor.SketchId
- Wall.SketchId
- Opening.SketchId
return the id of the element's sketch.
The method:
- Sketch.OwnerId
returns the id of the element that owns this...
1903 - API Changes - 2.1.6. Editing Sketches with SketchEditScope - Using the new class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.SketchEditScope
allows an application to edit sketch based elements while preserving the unchanged elements that are already present in the sketch. While a Ske...
1903 - API Changes - 2.1.7. Boundary validation for sketched elements - The new method:
- BoundaryValidation.IsValidHorizontalBoundary()
validates input curves form a valid horizontal boundary for Ceiling or Floor creation.
---
1903 - API Changes - 2.1.8. CompoundStructure API - The new method:
- CompoundStructure.CanSplitAndMergeRegionsBeUsed()
checks whether split and merge regions operations can be used for this compound structure. This validator is associated with the use...
1903 - API Changes - 2.2.1. Color Fill Schemes - The new class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.ColorFillScheme
represents a color scheme that can be applied to plan and section views.
Key new members of this class include:
- ColorFillScheme.AddEntry()
- ColorF...
1903 - API Changes - 2.2.2. Color Fill Scheme Entries - The new class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.ColorFillSchemeEntry
represents an entry in a color scheme.

- ColorFillSchemeEntry.Color
- ColorFillSchemeEntry.FillPatternId
...
1903 - API Changes - 2.2.3. View access to Color Fills - The new members:
- View.GetColorFillSchemeId()
- View.SetColorFillSchemeId()
provide access to read and apply the color fill scheme associated with a particular category in the view.
---
1903 - API Changes - 2.2.4. Color Fill Legends - The new class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.ColorFillLegend
offers the ability to create, read and modify properties of color fill legend annotation elements in a particular owner view.
Key new members of this...
1903 - API Changes - 2.3.1. Export to PDF - The new method:
- Document.Export(String, IList, PDFExportOptions)
exports one or more views and sheets in PDF format.
The options provided, in the new class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.PDFExportOptions
incl...
1903 - API Changes - 2.3.2. PDF Export Settings - The new element class:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExportPDFSettings
represents a named stored PDF export option available in a document. You can use this class to extract the options from this element to use...
1903 - API Changes - 2.5.1. Reference Curves, Planes, and Points - The new methods:
- DirectShape.AddReferenceCurve()
- DirectShape.AddReferencePlane()

- Dir...

represents an identifier for geometry from external sources.

- ExternalGeometryId.Id
provide valid...
1903 - API Changes - 2.5.3. Custom Family names - The new member:
- DirectShapeType.SetFamilyName()
provides the ability to set a custom Family name for a DirectShapeType.

- DirectShapeType.CanChangeFamilyName()
provides the abilit...
1903 - API Changes - 2.6.1. Cloud Model API additions - Four new methods allow access to identifying forge IDs for Cloud Models:
- Document.GetHubId(): ForgeDM hub id where the model locates.
- Document.GetProjectId(): ForgeDM project id where the model lo...
1903 - API Changes - 2.6.2. OpenOptions API - The new property:
- OpenOptions.IgnoreExtensibleStorageSchemaConflict
allows your application to ignore a schema conflict error on open. The default is false. Setting this to true will ignore the exce...

1947 - API Changes - 1.2.1. Analytical Model classes - - Removed API → Replacement
- AnalyticalModel → AnalyticalElement
- AnalyticalModelStick → AnalyticalMember
- AnalyticalModelColumn → AnalyticalMember
- AnalyticalModelSupport → None
- AnalyticalConsi...
1947 - API Changes - 1.2.2. Analytical Models classes additions - This new API is part of a broader Analytical Driven Modeling initiative for Revit that introduces a new approach to analytical modelling, enhancing its overall structural modelling capabilities. See t...
1947 - API Changes - 1.2.3. Analytical Model enums - - Removed API
- AnalyticalCurveType
- AnalyticalDirection
- AnalyticalProjectionType

2036 - 1. API Changes - What's New in the Revit 2025 API - * 1. API changes
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.3.1. MacroManager API - Updated Revit macro tool with modernized UI and code editor that also supports modern .NET API. Following methods were changed.
- Deprecated member(s) → Replacement members(s)
- MacroManager.AddModule...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.8.1. Distribution system - The following properties were modified to support high-leg delta and single-phase distribution system.
- Deprecated member(s) → Replacement members(s)
- AnalyticalPowerSourceData.Voltage → AnalyticalP...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.8.2. Parameter Naming - Improved naming for the following electrical parameters to remove ambiguity, improve accuracy, and better adhere with industry terminology.
- Parameter/String Attribute: Text(before) → Text(after)
- R...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.10.1. Duct Settings - Two new properties DuctSettings.AirDynamicViscosity and DuctPressureDropData.DynamicViscosity were added to clarify the value used in the duct pressure loss calculation. They replaced the deprecated p...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.11.1. Rebar - - Deprecated member(s) → Replacement member(s)
- RebarConstraintsManager.SetPreferredConstraintForHandle(RebarConstrainedHandle handle, RebarConstraint constraint) → RebarConstraintsManager.SetPreferr...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.13.1. Bending details in view - The following parameters were renamed without any changes to their functionality.
- Deprecated member(s) → Replacement member(s)
- BENDING_DETAIL_SEGMENET_REPESENTATION → BENDING_DETAIL_SEGMENT_REPRES...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.13.2. Analytical Surface - The following new method was added that allows users to verify if contour is valid for this Analytical Surface.
- Deprecated members(s) → Replacement member(s)
- AnalyticalSurfaceBase.isCurveLoopValid...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.16.1. Classes - - DocumentEntryPoint
---
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.16.2. Properties - - ViewSchedule.ImageRowHeight
- UIThemeManager.DefaultTheme
---
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.16.3. Methods - - FamilyManager.AddParameter(ExternalDefinition, BuiltInParameterGroup, bool)
- FamilyManager.AddParameter(string, BuiltInParameterGroup, Category, bool)
- FamilyManager.ReplaceParameter(FamilyParamet...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 1.16.4. Enums - - Autodesk.Revit.DB.Mechanical.OccupancyUnit – Removed enum value OccupancyUnit.UseDefaultValues
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.BaseLoadOn – Removed enum value BaseLoadOn.kUseDefaultLoad
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.1.1. MacroManager API - The new property:
- MacroModule.ModuleFolder – Returns the folder of the module.
The new interface:
- IModuleMaker
allows users to create new module project by implementing this interface.
The new eve...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.2.1. MEP Analytical networks - The new constructor allows users to traverse both sides of the specified analytical segment. In comparison, the existing constructor MEPNetworkIterator(Document, MEPAnalyticalNode, MEPAnalyticalSegmen...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.2.2. MEP Duct/Pipe Pressure Loss calculation - Users now have access to Duct/Pipe pressure loss characteristic allowing them to correlate the element and understand the calculation logic.
The new classes:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.Analysis.CriticalPathC...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.2.3. MEP Space Engineering Parameters - Users now have access to building operating day and year schedules allowing them to create and edit schedules that describe the usage of buildings (occupancy, power, lighting) for use in energy analys...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.4.1. Linear Array - The new methods:
- LinearArray.GetMinimumSize() – Allows users to get the minimum size of a linear array based on if the document is a family document.
- LinearArray.GetNumberOfMembersIncludingPlaceho...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.9.1. gbXML export options - We now provide support for legacy export of gbXML based on a conceptual energy analytical model from a conceptual mass model from add-ins/add-ons.
The new methods:
- GetMassIds() – Allows users to get...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.10.1. IFC Hybrid Import - - IFCHybridImport.UpdateElements() – The new method allows users to update elements previously imported via a Hybrid IFC Link operation.
- IFCHybridImport.GetIFCStepIdToElementIdMap() – The new method...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.10.2. IFC Category Mapping - Added functionality that allows user to control the way how Revit categories are mapped to IFC Classes during IFC Export. User can now create, retrieve and modify IFC category mapping templates.
The n...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.13.1. Rebar - Users now have the ability to create and modify rebar constraints to surfaces.
The new enum:
- RebarConstraintsStatus
represents the status of the constraints.
The new value for RebarConstraintType en...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.13.2. Rebar splice type options and rules - Added functionality for splicing the rebar. Users can now splice a rebar, remove the splice (keeping the bars separated), unify into one bar, modify the data related to splice and modify the constrain...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.14.1. UI Application - The new enum:
- ThemeType – Represents the application frame theme type. It has the following values:
- CanvasTheme – Indicates that the ThemeChanged event is triggered by canvas theme change.
- UIThe...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.15.1. Wall APIs - The new methods now allow users to selectively enable or disable end wrapping for a specific wall end when the wall's end wrap is activated in the Wall Type dialog.
- Revit.DB.Wall.GetWrappingLocation...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.16.1. Analytical Elements - The new methods:
- AnalyticalElement.IsValidTransform() – Allows users to check whether the value set for Local Coordinate System is valid for an Analytical Element.
- AnalyticalElement.SetTransform()...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.16.2. Analytical Surface - The new method:
- AnalyticalSurfaceBase.IsOuterContourValid() – Allows users to verify if contour is valid for this Analytical Surface.
---
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.16.3. Bending Details on Drawings - Added new functionality for enhancing bending details. These include the ability to create and customize the size of schematic bending detail boxes, set specific tag types for bending details, adjust ...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.16.4. Radial Array - The new methods:
- RadialArray.GetMinimumSize() – Allows users to get the minimum size of a radial array based on if the document is a family document.
- RadialArray.GetNumberOfMembersIncludingPlaceho...
2036 - 1. API Changes - 2.19.1. Context Menu - We now provide functionality to create context menu from an add-in.
The new Interface:
- Revit.UI.IContextMenuCreator – The interface users need to implement to build context menu.
The new Constructor...

- Autodesk.Revit.DB.SheetCollection – Represents a sheet collection in Autodesk Revit.
The new methods:
- Autodesk.Revit.DB.SheetCollection.Create(document, name) – Allows users to crea...

2073 - Lookup Foundation - `
  kb = 1024 byte
  floppy = 360 * kb = 368640 byte
  mb = 1024 * kb = 1048576 byte
  tb = 1024 * mb = 1073741824 byte
  tb / floppy = 2912.711111
